intro: Stelis discolor, commonly known as the pale stelis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is an epiphytic orchid, meaning it grows on the surface of other plants without being parasitic. The plant features slender, wiry stems that often curl and twist, and its leaves are usually narrow and革质 (leathery). The flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale in color, with a distinctive pattern of markings. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, organic-rich substrates for optimal growth.
